abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Smallholder Agriculture
            and Social Protection Support Operation Project for Cambodia
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the risk to
            development outcome was moderate; the Bank's
            performance was satisfactory; and the Borrower's
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: implementation results need to be identified and
            expressed as objectively verifiable target indicators. Joint
            monitoring of the program requires clear indicators which
            are agreed prior to implementation. While having a parallel
            Technical Assistance (TA) is desirable to implement agreed
            actions, the identification of appropriate targets and
            indicators of the program should be ideally based on prior
            analytical work. Different reforms will require different
            timeframes to move from agreement to implementation.
            Cross-sector programs require a clear understanding of
            incentives faced by all implementing agencies.
